title: Ray Cashley
text:
Alec Raymond "Ray" Cashley (born 23 October 1951 in <a href="Bristol">Bristol</a>, England) is an English former professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
He joined <a href="Bristol%20City%20F.C.">Bristol City</a> as a youth player and was their number one goalkeeper in the early 1970s despite starting his career as a fullback. He made his debut for Bristol City against Southampton in the FA Cup in 1970. In the 1975–76 season, City were promoted to the <a href="Football%20League%20First%20Division">First Division</a> but Cashley lost his place to <a href="John%20Shaw%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201954%29">John Shaw</a> soon afterwards and had only brief spells in the side for the remainder of his time with City. Cashley even scored a goal for City on 18 September <a href="1973-74%20in%20English%20football">1973</a>, with a long clearance from his own penalty area against <a href="Hull%20City%20A.F.C.">Hull City</a> on a gusty night. In total, he made 262 appearances, 227 of those in the league for The Robins.
Cashley had a loan spell with <a href="Hereford%20United%20F.C.">Hereford United</a> in 1981, making 20 league and 6 additional appearances for The Whites before playing for <a href="Clevedon%20Town%20F.C.">Clevedon Town</a>.
In August 1982 he returned to professional football with <a href="Bristol%20Rovers%20F.C.">Bristol Rovers</a>, who he made 53 league appearances for. He then played for <a href="Trowbridge%20Town%20F.C.">Trowbridge Town</a> before again returning to <a href="The%20Football%20League">The Football League</a> when he joined <a href="Chester%20City%20F.C.">Chester City</a> in October 1985. Cashley made nine appearances as City were promoted from <a href="Division%20Four">Division Four</a> at the end of the season.
After Chester, City came calling yet again, offering Cashley a role in the reserves, albeit without a contract. He would be able to step in to play for City if <a href="Keith%20Waugh">Keith Waugh</a> was unable and Cashley jumped at the chance for full-time football once again.
He subsequently played for non-league sides <a href="East%20Worle%20F.C.">East Worle</a> and <a href="Weston-super-Mare%20A.F.C.">Weston-super-Mare</a>.
